snippet: Under the temporary rules, employers give cash to charitable organizations in exchange for leave time employees agree to forgo.
abstract: Internal Revenue Service says that American employees can donate, through payroll deductions, their vacation, sick and personal leave days to organizations helping with Hurricane Sandy relief efforts; under the temporary rules, employers can give cash to charitable organizations in exchange for any leave time employees agree to forgo, and employees will not pay taxes on the donations.
lead_paragraph: Under the temporary rules, employers give cash to charitable organizations in exchange for leave time employees agree to forgo.
